lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers package¶

Submodules¶

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.conv module¶

Contains 2d conv layers

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.conv.conv1d_block(input_tensor, filters, kernel_size, layout='cnap', name=None, strides=1, padding='same', use_bias=True, activation=<function relu>, pool_size=2, pool_strides=2, is_training=True)[source]¶

Complex 1d convolution with batch normalization, activation and pooling layers

Parameters:
  • input_tensor (tf.Tensor) –
  • filters (int - number of filters in the ouput tensor) –
  • kernel_size (int - kernel size) –
  • layout (str - a sequence of layers) – c - convolution n - batch normalization a - activation p - max pooling
  • name (str - name of the layer that will be used as a scope) –
  • strides (int) –
  • padding (str - padding mode, can be 'same' or 'valid';) –
  • use_bias (bool) –
  • activation (callable) –
  • pool_size (int) –
  • pool_strides (int) –
  • is_training (bool or tf.Tensor) –
Returns:

output tensor
Return type:

tf.Tensor
lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.conv.conv2d_block(input_tensor, filters, kernel_size, layout='cnap', name=None, strides=(1, 1), padding='same', use_bias=True, activation=<function relu>, pool_size=(2, 2), pool_strides=(2, 2), is_training=True)[source]¶

Complex 2d convolution with batch normalization, activation and pooling layers

Parameters:
  • input_tensor (tf.Tensor) –
  • filters (int - number of filters in the ouput tensor) –
  • kernel_size (int or tuple(int, int) - kernel size) –
  • layout (str - a sequence of layers) – c - convolution n - batch normalization a - activation p - max pooling
  • name (str - name of the layer that will be used as a scope) –
  • strides (tuple(int, int)) –
  • padding (str - padding mode, can be 'same' or 'valid';) –
  • use_bias (bool) –
  • activation (callable) –
  • pool_size (tuple(int, int)) –
  • pool_strides (tuple(int, int)) –
  • is_training (bool or tf.Tensor) –
Returns:

output tensor
Return type:

tf.Tensor
lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.conv.conv3d_block(input_tensor, filters, kernel_size, layout='cnap', name=None, strides=(1, 1, 1), padding='same', use_bias=True, activation=<function relu>, pool_size=(2, 2, 2), pool_strides=(2, 2, 2), is_training=True)[source]¶

Complex 3d convolution with batch normalization, activation and pooling layers

Parameters:
  • input_tensor (tf.Tensor) –
  • filters (int - number of filters in the ouput tensor) –
  • kernel_size (int or tuple(int, int, int) - kernel size) –
  • layout (str - a sequence of layers) – c - convolution n - batch normalization a - activation p - max pooling
  • name (str - name of the layer that will be used as a scope) –
  • strides (tuple(int, int, int)) –
  • padding (str - padding mode, can be 'same' or 'valid';) –

  • activation (callable) –

output tensor

Module contents¶

Custom tf layers and operations

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.flatten(x, name=None)[source]¶

Flatten tensor to two dimensions (batch_size, item_vector_size)

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.iflatten(x, name=None)[source]¶

Flatten tensor to two dimensions (batch_size, item_vector_size) using inferred shape and numpy

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.maxout(x, depth, axis=-1, name='max')[source]¶

Shrink last dimension by making max pooling every depth channels

lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.layers.mip(x, depth, name='mip')[source]¶

Shrink last dimension by making max pooling every depth channels
